IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS TO BE VALUED AS A REGIONAL HEALTH CARE NETWORK PROVIDER OF QUALITY SERVICE BY ANTICIPATING AND MEETING THE HEALTH NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS TO BE VALUED AS A REGIONAL HEALTH CARE NETWORK PROVIDER OF QUALITY SERVICE BY ANTICIPATING AND MEETING THE HEALTH NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.Description: IN JULY 2008, SUMNER REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER COMPLETED A NEW MAIN HOSPITAL BUILDING ON ITS GALLATIN CAMPUS. THIS FACILITY INCLUDES A NEW PATIENT TOWER WITH 72 NEW MEDICAL SURGICAL PATIENT BEDS, 18 NEW ICU/CCU BEDS, NEW SURGERY AND RECOVERY AREAS, A NEW RADIOLOGY UNIT AND A MAJOR RENOVATION TO THE 17 BED MATERNITY UNIT, ALL TO ENHANCE CORE SERVICE CAPABILITIES TO THE RESIDENTS OF SUMNER, TROUSDALE AND SMITH COUNTIES, OUR PRIMARY SERVICE AREA. SUMNER REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER PROVIDES INPATIENT SERVICES TO MORE THAN 7,000 PATIENTS ANNUALLY.

Activity2.Description: SUMNER REGIONAL HEALTH SYSTEMS, INC. OPENED A NEW OUTPATIENT DIAGNOSTIC AND THERAPY CENTER WITH NEW EQUIPMENT, INCLUDING A CAT SCANNER, MAGNETIC RESONANCE IMAGER, MAMMOGRAPHY, ULTRASOUND AND BONE DENSITOMETRY EQUIPMENT. THE NEW FACILITY AND EQUIPMENT ALLOW SUMNER REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER AND SUMNER REGIONAL HEALTH SYSTEMS, INC. TO DELIVER STATE OF THE ART MEDICAL SERVICES TO THE RESIDENTS OF OUR COMMUNITIES. AS A RESULT OF THIS INVESTMENT, SUMNER REGIONAL HEALTH SYSTEMS, INC. PROVIDES MORE THAN 160,000 OUTPATIENT VISITS ANNUALLY.

Activity3.Description: SUMNER REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER, INC. OFFERS ITS EMERGENCY ROOM SERVICES 24 HOURS A DAY, 365 DAYS EACH YEAR. THE EMERGENCY ROOM IS HOUSED IN THE NEW PATIENT TOWER AND IS STAFFED BY QUALIFIED EMERGENCY PHYSICIANS, MANY OF WHOM WERE TRAINED AT VANDERBILT UNIVERSITY AND ARE BOARD CERTIFIED IN EMERGENCY MEDICINE. SUMNER REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER, INC. SERVICES MORE THAN 38,000 PATIENTS FOR EMERGENCY VISITS ANNUALLY.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS A PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUND FOR THE PURPOSE OF FUNDING THE HEALTH SYSTEM'S MEDICAL LIBRARY. INCOME GENERATED FROM THE ENDOWMENT FUND IS USED TO PURCHASE BOOKS AND PERIODICALS FOR THE MEDICAL LIBRARY.

Name.BusinessNameLine1: FAMILY WELLNESS GROUP OF MIDDLE TN LLC

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE ARE PRESENTED NET OF ALLOWANCE FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS. SRHS PROVIDES AN ALLOWANCE FOR DOUBTFUL COLLECTIONS BASED UPON A REVIEW OF OUTSTANDING RECEIVABLES, HISTORICAL COLLECTION INFORMATION, AND EXISTING ECONOMIC CONDITIONS. ALL THIRD PARTY PAYER ACCOUNT BALANCES GREATER THAN 180 DAYS PAST DUE ARE CONSIDERED DELINQUENT AND REFLECTED IN THE BAD DEBT RESERVE ALLOWANCE. INTEREST IS NOT CHARGED ON OUTSTANDING PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.GeneralExplanation: PATIENTS ELIGIBLE UNDER THE ORGANIZATION'S CHARITY CARE POLICY, PART III, LINE 3, THE ORGANIZATION CURRENTLY DOES NOT ESTIMATE THE AMOUNT OF THE ORGANIZATION'S BAD DEBT EXPENSES ATTRIBUTABLE TO PATIENTS ELIGIBLE UNDER THE ORGANIZATION'S CHARITY CARE POLICY. ACCORDINGLY NO AMOUNT HAS BEEN REPORTED ON PART III, LINE 3 OF SCHEDULE H.,

DEBT COLLECTION POLICY, SCHEDULE H, PART III, SECTION C, LINE 9, THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE A WRITTEN DEBT COLLECTION POLICY; HOWEVER IT DOES HAVE A FORMAL WRITTEN PROCESS FOR HANDING DEBT COLLECTION AS FOLLOWS: PATIENT ACCESS WILL ATTEMPT TO COLLECT ANY PATIENT RESPONSIBILITY OF THE DATE OF SERVICE. A PROMPT PAY DISCOUNT IS OFFERED TO THE PATIENT IF THE ESTIMATED AMOUNT IS PAID IN FULL ON DATE OF SERVICE. IF THE PATIENT HAS INSURANCE, THE INSURANCE PLAN IN BILLED USING PAYER-SPECIFIC BILLING GUIDELINES. SELF-PAY BALANCES WHERE A PATIENT HAS NO INSURANCE AND SELF-PAY BALANCES AFTER INSURANCE ARE SUBMITTED TO AN EXTENDED BUSINESS OFFICE VENDOR FOR COLLECTION. ACCOUNTS ARE WORKED BY THE EXTENDED BUSINESS OFFICE FOR 120 DAYS. ANY UNCOLLECTED BALANCE IS RETURN TO PATIENT FINANCIAL SERVICES AND THEN SUBMITTED TO A BAD DEBT AGENCY. FINANCIAL COUNSELOR PROCESSES ACCOUNT VIA MEDITECH REPORTS ASSURING COLLECTION EFFORTS HAVE BEEN EXHAUSTED AND THE APPROPRIATE NUMBER OF STATEMENTS HAVE BEEN SENT TO THE PATIENT. UNCOLLECTABLE BALANCES AT THE BAD DEBT AGENCY ARE CONSIDERED FOR SUIT AND COLLECTION IN RESPECTIVE COUNTY COURTS. OUR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM IS EXPLAINED TO ALL SELF-PAY PATIENTS PRIOR TO SERVICE. FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, WHEN APPLICABLE, IS OFFERED TO PATIENTS DURING THE COLLECTION PROCESS BY THE EXTENDED BUSINESS OFFICE. ANY UNCOLLECTIBLE MEDICARE BALANCES THAT ARE NOT RETURNED TO PATIENT FINANCIAL SERVICES ARE REVIEWED FOR INCLUSION OF THE MEDICARE BAD DEBT LOGS. FINANCIAL COUNSELORS TRY TO TALK WITH ALL SELF-PAY PATIENTS PRIOR TO DISCHARGE FROM THE HOSPITAL. IF THEY FAIL TO MEET WITH THEM BEFORE DISCHARGE, MED ASSIST AND/OR THE EXTENDED BUSINESS OFFICE MAKES PHONE CALLS TO DISCUSS THE GUARANTOR'S ABILITY TO PAY THEIR BALANCE. IF THE GUARANTOR STATES THEY ARE FINANCIAL UNABLE TO PAY THEIR BALANCE, A FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE APPLICATION IS OFFERED. THE GUARANTOR IS TOLD WHAT SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS ARE NECESSARY AND THAT THE APPLICATION SHOULD BE RETURNED WITHIN 10 BUSINESS DAYS.,

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: SRHS PAID ATTORNEY FEES FOR ITS CEO, WILLIAM T. SUGG, INCURRED ADDRESSING MATTERS RELATED TO HIS TERMINATION AGREEMENT.

SRHS PAID ITS CEO, WILLIAM T. SUGG, SEVERANCE PAYMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH THE TERMS OF HIS TERMINATION AGREEMENT. THIS AGREEMENT REQUIRES THE ORGANIZATION TO PROVIDE WILLIAM T. SUGG WITH TWELVE MONTHLY PAYMENTS OF $139,723 EACH ON THE MONTHLY ANNIVERSARY OF OCTOBER 20, 2009.
SRHS PAID ITS CEO, WILLIAM T. SUGG $1,141,155 IN DECEMBER 2009 FOR THE ASSETS HELD IN TRUST UNDER SRHS'S SERP.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1: HEALTH EDUCATION AND HOUSING FACILITIES BOARD
HEALTH EDUCATION AND HOUSING FACILITIES BOARD

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 3
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2010 THE ORGANIZATION ENGAGED NAVIGANT CONSULTING, A MANAGEMENT AND ADVISORY CONSULTING COMPANY, TO PERFORM MANAGEMENT DUTIES CUSTOMARILY PERFORMED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES. THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUALS PERFORMED SERVICES TO SUMNER REGIONAL HEALTH SYSTEMS, INC. & AFFILIATES THROUGH NAVIGANT CONSULTING: DR. ROGER E. KAISER JR., CEO - PART YEAR WAITE POPEJOY, CHIEF RESTRUCTURING OFFICER ACCORDINGLY, THE INDIVIDUALS LISTED ABOVE HAVE BEEN REPORTED AS OFFICERS IN PART VII, SECTION A OF THE FORM 990.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Review of form 990 by governing body
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S MANAGEMENT WORKS WITH ITS INDEPENDENT THIRD PARTY TAX PREPARERS TO COMPLETE THE FORM 990. UPON ITS COMPLETION, THE ORGANIZATION'S MANAGEMENT PERFORMS A DETAILED PRELIMINARY REVIEW OF THE PREPARED FORM 990. SUBSEQUENT TO THIS REVIEW THE FULL FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED TO THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ANNUALLY ALL MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING BODY, OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES (INTERESTED PERSONS) ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST THAT EXIST WITH THE ORGANIZATION THROUGH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRE. COMPLETED CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRES ARE RETURNED TO THE ORGANIZATION'S COMPLIANCE OFFICER FOR REVIEW. IF A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST ARISES WITH AN INTERESTED PERSON, THE ORGANIZATION'S COMPLIANCE OFFICER REQUESTS ADDITIONAL INFORMATION RELATED TO THE NATURE OF THE CONFLICT. IF IT IS DETERMINED AN ACTUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS BETWEEN AN INTERESTED PERSON AND THE ORGANIZATION, ANY PERSON WITH A CONFLICT IS REQUIRED TO ABSTAIN FROM MAKING MOTIONS, PARTICIPATING IN RELEVANT DELIBERATIONS, VOTING, EXECUTING AGREEMENTS, ATTEMPTING TO INFLUENCE OTHERS' VOTES, OR TAKING ANY OTHER SIMILAR DIRECT ACTION ON BEHALF OF THE CORPORATION WHERE THE CONFLICT OR DUALITY ON INTEREST MIGHT PERTAIN.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Process used to establish compensation of top management official
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS UTILIZES COMPARABILITY DATA FROM A COMPENSATION SURVEY TO DETERMINE THE COMPENSATION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIAL, OTHER OFFICERS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES. THE FINAL COMPENSATION PACKAGES ARE SUBJECT TO THE FULL BOARD REVIEW AND APPROVAL AND ARE DOCUMENTED IN A WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT. DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS REGARDING THE COMPENSATION PACKAGES ARE DOCUMENTED IN THE MINUTES OF THE MEETING. EFFECTIVE SEPTEMBER 10 2009, THE EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S CEO, WILLIAM T. SUGG, WAS TERMINATED. IN CONNECTION WITH THE TERMINATION AGREEMENT, SUMNER REGIONAL HEALTH SYSTEM, INC. WAS REQUIRED TO PROVIDE CERTAIN BENEFITS AND COMPENSATION. THE TAXABLE BENEFITS HAVE BEEN INCLUDED IN WILLIAM T. SUGG'S COMPENSATION AND ARE REPORTED IN SCHEDULE J OF THE FORM 990 ACCORDINGLY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Process used to establish compensation of other officers/key employees
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: SEE NARRATIVE FOR PART VI, LINE 15A.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: COMPENSATION OF OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, ETC.
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1(A), COLUMN (B)
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WILLIAM T. SUGG, CEO (JUNE 2009 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 2009), DEVOTED APPROXIMATELY 5 HOURS A WEEK TO TROUSEDALE MEDICAL CENTER, INC., 5 HOURS A WEEK TO FRANK T. RUTHERFORD MEMORIAL HOSPITAL, INC., AND 5 HOURS A WEEK TO SUMNER REGIONAL HEALTH SYSTEMS FOUNDATION, INC., ALL OF WHICH ARE RELATED TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS. ROGER KAISER, JR., CEO (JUNE 2009 THROUGH MAY 2010), DEVOTED APPROXIMATELY 5 HOURS A WEEK TO TROUSEDALE MEDICAL CENTER, INC. AND 5 HOURS A WEEK TO FRANK T. RUTHERFORD MEMORIAL HOSPITAL, INC., BOTH OF WHICH ARE RELATED TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS. WAITE POPEJOY, CHIEF RESTRUCTURING OFFICER (JUNE 2009 THROUGH MAY 2010), DEVOTED APPROXIMATELY 5 HOURS A WEEK TO TROUSEDALE MEDICAL CENTER, INC. AND 5 HOURS A WEEK TO FRANK T. RUTHERFORD MEMORIAL HOSPITAL, INC., BOTH OF WHICH ARE RELATED TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS. DAVE WILHOITE, CFO (JUNE 2009 THROUGH MAY 2010), DEVOTED APPROXIMATELY 5 HOURS A WEEK TO TROUSEDALE MEDICAL CENTER, INC., 5 HOURS A WEEK TO FRANK T. RUTHERFORD MEMORIAL HOSPITAL, INC., AND 5 HOURS A WEEK TO SUMNER REGIONAL HEALTH SYSTEMS FOUNDATION, INC., ALL OF WHICH ARE RELATED TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS.

THE TAX-EXEMPT BOND ISSUES LISTED IN PART I OF SCHEDULE K WERE ISSUED TO SUMNER REGIONAL HEALTH SYSTEMS, INC. A PORTION OF THE PROCEEDS FOR BOTH THE 2008 AND 2007 SERIES BONDS WERE ALLOCATED TO TWO SUBSIDIARIES OF SUMNER REGIONAL HEALTH SYSTEMS, INC.: TROUSDALE MEDICAL CENTER, INC. AND FRANK T. RUTHERFORD MEMORIAL HOSPITAL, INC. THE ENTIRE ISSUANCE AND RELATED INFORMATION FOR THE 2008 AND 2007 SERIES BONDS ARE REPORTED ON SCHEDULE K OF THE SUMNER REGIONAL HEALTH SYSTEMS, INC. 2009 FORM 990.
